tor10.Symmetry¶

class tor10.Symmetry.U1[source]¶

U1 Symmetry class. The U1 symmetry can have quantum number represent as arbitrary unsigned integer.

Fusion rule for combine two quantum number:

q1 + q2
>>> b1 = tor10.Bond(3,tor10.BD_BRA, qnums=[[0],[0],[1 ]     ],sym_types=[tor10.Symmetry.U1()])
>>> b2 = tor10.Bond(4,tor10.BD_BRA, qnums=[[0],[2],[-3],[-1]],sym_types=[tor10.Symmetry.U1()])
>>> print(b1)
Dim = 3 |
BRA     : U1::  +1 +0 +0

>>> print(b2)
Dim = 4 |
BRA     : U1::  +2 +0 -1 -3

>>> b1.combine(b2)
>>> print(b1)
Dim = 12 |
BRA     : U1::  +3 +1 +0 -2 +2 +0 -1 -3 +2 +0 -1 -3
class tor10.Symmetry.Zn(n)[source]¶

Z(n) Symmetry class. The Z(n) symmetry can have integer quantum number, with n > 1.

Fusion rule for combine two quantum number:

(q1 + q2)%n
>>> b1 = tor10.Bond(3,tor10.BD_BRA, qnums=[[0],[2],[1 ]     ],sym_types=[tor10.Symmetry.Zn(4)])
>>> b2 = tor10.Bond(4,tor10.BD_BRA, qnums=[[0],[2],[3],[1]  ],sym_types=[tor10.Symmetry.Zn(4)])
>>> print(b1)
Dim = 3 |
BRA     : Z4::  +2 +1 +0

>>> print(b2)
Dim = 4 |
BRA     : Z4::  +3 +2 +1 +0

>>> b1.combine(b2)
>>> print(b1)
Dim = 12 |
BRA     : Z4::  +1 +0 +3 +2 +0 +3 +2 +1 +3 +2 +1 +0
class tor10.Symmetry.Zn(n)[source]

Z(n) Symmetry class. The Z(n) symmetry can have integer quantum number, with n > 1.

Fusion rule for combine two quantum number:

(q1 + q2)%n
>>> b1 = tor10.Bond(3,tor10.BD_BRA, qnums=[[0],[2],[1 ]     ],sym_types=[tor10.Symmetry.Zn(4)])
>>> b2 = tor10.Bond(4,tor10.BD_BRA, qnums=[[0],[2],[3],[1]  ],sym_types=[tor10.Symmetry.Zn(4)])
>>> print(b1)
Dim = 3 |
BRA     : Z4::  +2 +1 +0

>>> print(b2)
Dim = 4 |
BRA     : Z4::  +3 +2 +1 +0

>>> b1.combine(b2)
>>> print(b1)
Dim = 12 |
BRA     : Z4::  +1 +0 +3 +2 +0 +3 +2 +1 +3 +2 +1 +0
__init__(n)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

class tor10.Symmetry.U1[source]

U1 Symmetry class. The U1 symmetry can have quantum number represent as arbitrary unsigned integer.

Fusion rule for combine two quantum number:

q1 + q2
>>> b1 = tor10.Bond(3,tor10.BD_BRA, qnums=[[0],[0],[1 ]     ],sym_types=[tor10.Symmetry.U1()])
>>> b2 = tor10.Bond(4,tor10.BD_BRA, qnums=[[0],[2],[-3],[-1]],sym_types=[tor10.Symmetry.U1()])
>>> print(b1)
Dim = 3 |
BRA     : U1::  +1 +0 +0

>>> print(b2)
Dim = 4 |
BRA     : U1::  +2 +0 -1 -3

>>> b1.combine(b2)
>>> print(b1)
Dim = 12 |
BRA     : U1::  +3 +1 +0 -2 +2 +0 -1 -3 +2 +0 -1 -3
